The town is arranged along its main street, and pretty much everything of note is on it. You could easily walk from one end of town to the other in perhaps an hour, much of it along shaded sidewalks, under trees. Bicycles are not recommended, as there aren't any bike lanes or such, and the sidewalks are used by many pedestrians.

Kiwanis Park is a fair sized park off main street, which has a large block of pure salt as a central attraction, along with a stream and picnic areas. You can also barbecue on the provided metal grills if you bring your own charcoal.

Woodland Cemetery has a spectacular view and a civil war monument. It's a very photogenic area, and gives a good view of the surrounding area, as well as being very peaceful and having several unique grave stones.
Main Street Pizza - serving Pizza by the slice, wings, steak sandwiches, and meatball subs
Rukart's Tavern - local tavern with some food, drinks, and entertainment
Tangerine Bar and Lounge - local bar with some food and drinks, entertainment
